newsitem.title: FINLAND: HELSINKI HOLDS MINOR GAINS, SEEN CAUTIOUS.
newsitem.headline: HELSINKI HOLDS MINOR GAINS, SEEN CAUTIOUS.

text.p: Shares struggled to hold
minor gains in thin trade on Thursday and brokers saw little
scope for strengthening as many investors remained sidelined
ahead of key first-quarter earnings reports this week and next.
"I think we've had about all the help we are going to have
for today," one broker said after forestries gained on the Q1
report from Swedish Stora .
Brokers said UPM-Kymmene clearly rose on Stora's
report. It added 1.20 markka to a session high of 116.20 before
settling at 116.00 in fairly lively 28 million markka volume.
Nokia traded up 1.60 markka at 303.60 matching its Wall
Street close after touching 304.50 in lax trade, with investors
playing wait-and-see ahead of Q1 reports from Swedish
Ericsson on Friday and Nokia itself on Tuesday, brokers
said.
Asko rose 0.50 markka to 91.00 in a second straight
day of heavy volume stemming from a few big deals matched
in-house at Evli Securities. Brokers declined to guess at who
the buyers and sellers were.
Nordic Aluminium, in its first day of bourse
trade, came off a high of 55.00 markka to trade at 54.00.
